caption: One of a school that can be visited by local/ tourist. It‚Äôs really great school to have this kind of beautiful view, it's calm and quiet. Usually there are no crowds and they have lots of sitting bench and you can enjoy the day. There are also many parc/ Jardin beautiful places nearby to be explored in such as arboretum, stadium or parc de floral.

My favorite place in Paris. It's calm and quiet. Usually there are no crowds and they have lots of little nooks where you can install yourself and enjoy the day. I love this place in all seasons. It's easy to get to by metro. There are places nearby for snacks and a bathroom next door at the arboretum.
Magnificent place where you discover another nature! This place is totally free and a delight for the eyes. There are very pleasant areas to rest.
An incredible school with the most colorful summer flower beds. To discover absolutely

A whole day spent in this relaxing and magnificent place. Extremely well maintained, perfect calm, lots of species of plants, trees, shrubs... The staff there are very friendly and do not hesitate to give advice. On the edge of the Bois de Vincennes, next to the Joinville RER, a haven of peace. Well done and thank you to the whole team üëã

The garden of this absolutely magnificent school. Lots of very different corners, majestic trees, flowers, wetlands, vegetable plants, a large meadow.... you won't be bored there for a second. Plus it‚Äôs easy to come here with children. It‚Äôs a perfect place to teach them about plants.

We had a wonderful discovery of the √âcole du Breuil gardens located near the Arboretum. We appreciated the different areas which are maintained and highlighted with taste and originality. Do not hesitate to go to the greenhouses you will see a magnificent collection of plants of various species as well as an ornamental vegetable garden mixing vegetables and flowers in perfect harmony. The gardeners are friendly and open to information. We had a lovely time and we wouldn't hesitate to come back at another time of year.

Very beautiful place, a chance for garden lovers and admirers, that it is accessible to the public. Various worlds are present, the maintenance is exceptional. The variety of plants is significant and will delight visitors. Of course, in each season, the garden deserves to be visited as it must be adorned with different colors and its atmosphere must evolve. In addition, access to the garden is free.

A beautiful walk, accessible to all, surrounded by exceptional flora. This is what the Breuil school garden has in store for you, right next to the Vincennes racecourse. Served by the bus, you can also easily park your car right in front. Entrance is free and once you pass through the gate, the immense park is open to you: remarkable trees, flowers, ponds and small water hearts, vegetable garden, beehives....the walk has a thousand surprises in store for you! Note that at the very back of the garden, a large open space allows children to play ball, frisbee or even badminton. Away from the Bois de Vincennes, this place attracts few people and is a good place for those looking for calm.
Magnificent garden with colors, smells, butterflies, crickets... we have a great time with the family... and no problem parking on a Sunday at 9:45 a.m. just a stone's throw away by car.
Pure pleasure, a magnificent walk, flowers galore, interesting installations, and gardeners ready to answer any question with a smile :) My advice, take buses 201 or 77 to get to the garden....

Magnificent botanical and horticultural garden, little known. It is a pleasant place where you can discover many plants and flowers. Some furnished spaces are ideal for relaxation. A few minutes walk from the RER Joinville-le-Pont. I also recommend the Paris arboretum just opposite. And if you came there with a book to spend a few moments of peace and quiet and find freshness...

Labeled a remarkable garden, the botanical garden is open to the public all year round. It is maintained by the students and teachers of the Breuil school. So we find lots of explanations on plants and soils. Very educational for those who are interested in plants, but also pleasant for those who want to be content with being in a beautiful, quiet garden with their children.
Very beautiful, particularly well-kept park. A moment of calm in this green setting.

My school gardens are open to the public ALL year round. The school celebration will take place on May 29 and 30, 2021 with plant sales by the BTS to finance their study trip as well as meetings with teachers and gardeners from Paris town hall. Come many!!

Superb walk for those who love flowers, trees, lianas, exotic plants and other cacti. The building is not extraordinary but the gardens are undeniably worth a look. Velibs allow you to stop or leave there without worry.

Very good school of landscape and horticulture. And the park is magnificent in spring, especially the Mediterranean part ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è I did my professional baccalaureate in landscaping and surely because this sector will surely disappear, it leaves us a little behind. And I have the impression that we never finish our practical projects and that's a real shame. The BTSA in this school must be great, he learns really interesting things.
A little-known garden but worth the detour, very well maintained by the teams and which has a remarkable botanical collection.

Brilliant place discovered thanks to the school festival on May 25 and 26. Lots of space and calm, a library to learn everything about plants but also the history of gardens,... An adorable welcome, excellent guided tour (thank you Laurent). I will come back with great pleasure üòçüòçüòç

Gorgeous. Very pretty flower beds, arrangements of garden plots. Very pleasant in spring. The benches, seats and other armchairs invite you to take your time. A real zen moment with only one downside: the background noise of the A4 cars' sweepers.
Small and pretty. Wilder than I expected. Spaces that invite you to sit and chat. Free! 1/2 hour to go around walking normally
It‚Äôs a magnificent place and great discovery for a family outing. I recommend

A shame on the part of the teaching team who participate in the harassment of their own members in a childish and unfair manner, adults in their old age who attack younger people and refuse to listen to them. Avoid if you want to work in a healthy environment
Charming garden where you can enjoy a beautiful bucolic walk
A magical place! Pleasant in every season, to enjoy the thousand colors of nature all year round...
School of gardens of the city of Paris. The gardens are public and are worth a visit. There is also an interesting arboretum on the sidewalk opposite. Entertainment on certain days. Friendly welcome.

beautiful garden, the labeling of the plants needs to be maintained because it is not always present or next to the plant. If you're looking for a particular plant, it's not easy to find your way around... the people there don't provide any information. Shame.

Having attended different training courses (university, professional training) this training that I am currently taking on a work-study basis is really great. the teaching team and gardeners are very professional, very attentive and passionate. They sometimes find themselves in a rush because they work a lot. Their ideas are both innovative and adapted to diverse audiences. There is really quality teaching and something to do to admire the plants in the public areas. For those who like to read, the specialist library is great (as is the team). As with everything there is always something to complain about but I only get positive things from it and going there puts me in a very good mood.

Magnificent place, very well flowered, invites you to relax and daydream. You can discover different species of plants there (and trees at the arboretum opposite). Small watering holes, with some ducks and moorhens.
This is another floral park in the Bois de Vincennes maintained by the teachers and students of the school. Pleasant, very quiet walk. Quite uncrowded

A superb place to learn or to stroll - without forgetting its arboretum. It was a chance for me to be able to do my training there, I simply regret not having discovered this place - quite discreet and little known to Parisians - sooner. But that is perhaps what makes it so pleasant, because it is never crowded like the gardens of Paris intramural can be. And the gardeners are all friendly and willing to pass on their knowledge! See you soon, dear school!
We had a very pleasant walk, the gardens are fabulous and all the flowers and plants are wonderful. Thank you to the students ‚ù§Ô∏è

Garden maintained among others by the students of the agricultural high school and which invites you to take a short walk in this place away from tourists. Accessible by RATP buses 77 and 201 or Joinville le pont station, about ten minutes on foot.
Right in front of the absolutely splendid arboretum!

Be careful during adult training interviews (received and judged as in CP) good job. Inappropriate, contemptuous remarks and down-to-earth humor! However, I had made an effort for 6 hours to be on the site and then meet there. Too bad I like this job Otherwise the garden is very beautiful...
Very nice place with its College de France annex
Superb, beautiful, quiet location in August. The people who work there are lovely. First visit but certainly not the last.
before or after visiting the arboretum it is a significant addition to discovering the subtlety of the work of landscapers. New visit + photos Saturday October 16, 2021.
